id: SA's Ferguson ruled out of Shield game
paragraph:
By

Australian Associated Press

Published:
  19:39 EST, 24 October 2018

 | 
Updated:
  19:39 EST, 24 October 2018

South Australian batsman and Test hopeful Callum Ferguson has been ruled out of the Sheffield Shield game against Queensland because of a calf injury.The Bulls have won the toss and will bat first at Adelaide Oval on Thursday, with Ferguson unable to play after injuring a calf at match-eve training.The Redbacks summoned Tom Cooper as his replacement, with Test candidates Matthew Renshaw and Joe Burns to open the batting for Queensland.Teams: SA: Travis Head (capt), Tom Cooper, Jake Lehmann, Conor McInerney, Joe Mennie, Harry Nielsen, Lloyd Pope, Kane Richardson, Chadd Sayers, Cameron Valente, Jake Weatherald, Nick Winter (12th man).Queensland: Jimmy Peirson (capt), Joe Burns, Brendan Doggett, Luke Feldman, Sam Heazlett, Charlie Hemphrey, Marnus Labuschagne, Michael Neser, Matthew Renshaw, Mitch Swepson, Jack Wildermuth, Mark Steketee (12th man).Sorry we are not currently accepting comments on this article.Published by Associated Newspapers LtdPart of the Daily Mail, The Mail on Sunday & Metro Media Group
